page.title: 13St.LAURENCE CHURCH COWLEY
page.content: St.Laurence church is very old, probably 1000 years old.It shows signs of a priests door dating from the 13th century.The roof is supported by trestles on solid oak beams made of tree trunks carved into shape.The walls are mostly flint and brick with stone supports.All the windows are of different ages.St.Laurence is one of the few churches to have a chimney. Quite recently in February 1985 deathwatch beetle was found to have attacked the woodwork under the pews at the back of the church.The church is still well used today for Sunday worship and ceremonies such as Baptism,weddings,funerals and other festivals.
